node.title: One dead after police fire on protesters in Sri Lanka amid bailout talks with IMF

node.title: Student loan program changes could bring millions closer to getting out of debt
node.description: A review found some servicers had been placing borrowers facing financial difficulties into forbearance instead of giving them clear information about income-driven repayment options.

node.title: Haven't filed taxes? Here's the penalty for late returns
node.description: Millions of Americans file returns after the Tax Day deadline. If you're in that group, here's what determines how much you'll owe.

node.title: Judge dismisses murder charges against Suzanne Morphew's husband
node.description: Barry Morphew was charged last year with killing his wife, who was last seen on Mother's Day 2020.

node.title: Amazon is planning a racial audit of its workforce
node.description: Former Attorney General Loretta Lynch will lead the probe, focusing on the company's nearly 1 million hourly workers.

node.title: Judge enters not guilty plea for Lori Daybell, mom charged in kids' death
node.description: Daybell and her new husband, Chad Daybell, face numerous charges, including conspiracy to commit murder and first-degree murder

node.title: Residents angry after years of inaction from Kāinga Ora
node.description: Couches, blankets and a broken pram are just some of the items that have been dumped in an empty section in the Tauranga suburb of Hairini.

node.title: Nets star Kyrie Irving fined for making "obscene gestures," official says
node.description: Irving gave the crowd at TD Garden the middle finger and directed "profane language" toward them, according to CBS Sports and NBA officials.

node.title: Some BNZ customers unable to use eftpos cards over Easter
node.description: A banking error over Easter meant some customers were unable to use their eftpos cards, despite having money in their accounts.

node.title: Ex-Maryland Mayor Andrew Bradshaw avoids prison in revenge porn case
node.description: Former Cambridge Mayor Andrew Bradshaw pleaded guilty to five counts of distributing revenge porn online.

node.title: Autopsy confirms Patrick Lyoya was shot in the head by Michigan cop
node.description: Lyoya, who was not armed, was killed after a traffic stop in western Michigan on April 4.

node.title: Barnett to bring 'intensity and passion' to Warriors pack
node.description: Newcastle Knights forward Mitchell Barnett has been granted an early release from his contract with the NRL club, to join the Warriors from next year.

node.title: Navy investigating after three soldiers die on same ship within a week
node.description: The Navy said there's no initial indication to suggest there is a correlation between the three deaths.

node.title: Retail is plagued with workers making less than $15 an hour
node.description: More than 90% of workers at Dollar General earn below $15 an hour, according to survey from economic think tank.

node.title: Services sector rebounds as Omicron shock subsides
node.description: The BNZ-Business New Zealand Performance of Services Index rose last month, indicating the sector is in expansion.

node.title: Black man shot in back of head by Michigan police, independent autopsy says

node.title: Man dies after crash in Christchurch
node.description: A 22-year-old man has died following a crash involving one vehicle and two motorcycles in Christchurch.

node.title: MIQ not justified beyond November, health officials told govt last year
node.description: Top health officials agreed MIQ was "no longer justified" for most returnees months before incoming travellers were able to enter freely, according to a document the Ministry of Health tried to keep…

node.title: Boris Johnson says it "did not occur to me" that gathering broke COVID rules
node.description: Last week, Johnson was fined 50 pounds ($66)  for attending his own surprise birthday party in June 2020, making him the first British prime minister ever found to have broken the law while in office.

node.title: Retired conservative judge willing to testify about Pence and Jan. 6
node.description: Retired Judge J. Michael Luttig, who advised Mike Pence against trying to delay Joe Biden's victory, says he'd be "glad" to testify.

node.title: What the federal mask mandate ruling could mean for future pandemics
node.description: For now, federal agencies are reviewing the judge's decision, a Biden administration official said.

node.title: Police: daughter killed mom during custody dispute at Texas Starbucks
node.description: Police say it was a child custody dispute that left a grandmother dead and a daughter accused of her murder.

node.title: US will no longer enforce mask mandate on airplanes, trains after court ruling
node.description: The Biden administration will no longer enforce a US mask mandate on public transportation, after a federal judge in Florida on Monday ruled that the 14-month-old directive was unlawful.

node.title: More suspensions for Super Rugby players
node.description: Crusaders captain Scott Barrett, Hurricanes hooker Asafo Aumua and Highlanders lock Josh Dickson have all received lengthy bans following dangerous play in Super Rugby over the weekend.

node.title: Oath Keepers exchanged messages about Ronny Jackson during Jan. 6 riot

node.title: U.K. soldiers captured in Ukraine appeal for prisoner swap
node.description: Propaganda clips aired on Russian TV show two captured British citizens, Shaun Pinner and Aiden Aslin.

node.title: Uber and Lyft drop mask requirements
node.description: Uber and Lyft riders and drivers may now leave their masks at home, after a judge struck down a federal mask mandate.
